title: OSX app always crash on first launch
body: Hi, just downloaded the latest release and I cannot start fvim from osx. Here's the window I get with the error message: Currently installed neovim version is `NVIM v0.5.0-53b0258`. OS is macOS Catalina 10.15 (19A602). Let me know if I can provide any further info. Thanks!

title: CapsLock does not work
body:
CapsLock does not work in fvim. It always inputs lowercase. 
I only can input upper case by hold shift key, but I don't think it is a good idea when I want to input a sequence of upper words.
I use the **v0.2-132-ge81f09a** fvim-win-x64.zip on **Windows 10 x64 1903 18362.418** and **NeoVim 0.4.2** x64 download from NeoVim github release.
It still happened after I deleted my `init.vim` file.
My `ginit.vim`
```viml
if exists('g:fvim_loaded')
    set guifont=Source\ Code\ Pro:h20
    nnoremap <silent> <C-ScrollWheelUp> :set guifont=+<CR>
    nnoremap <silent> <C-ScrollWheelDown> :set guifont=-<CR>
    nnoremap <A-CR> :FVimToggleFullScreen<CR>

    FVimFontAntialias v:true
    FVimFontAutohint v:true
    FVimFontSubpixel v:true
    FVimFontHintLevel 'full'
    FVimFontLcdRender v:true
    FVimFontAutoSnap v:true
    FVimUIPopupMenu v:true
endif
```

title: API for OS window location
body:
Coming from emacs/spacemacs I'm used to being able to have multiple frames open at a time and being able to navigate between them using a keyboard. I'm interested in building this functionality in neovim/fvim, but to get it to work smoothly I need some way to get the current window position from vimscript.

I do not want to distract you from the awesome work you are doing, but I would appreciate it if you could give any off the top of your head hints for where I might look to implement such a feature.

Thanks again for your great work.

title: Different selection colors in fvim
body:
In nvim qt and terminal nvim, selection colors are set by the color scheme.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3323631/65936751-89708200-e3d2-11e9-9671-155fdc5f3d3b.png)

In fvim however they appear to be default or something similar

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3323631/65936762-93928080-e3d2-11e9-8739-bfb64a23f826.png)

title: enhanced apilevel query, e.g. detect nvim_input_mouse()
Failed to run on windows
body:
![](https://files.gitter.im/SpaceVim/SpaceVim/nkUz/image.png)

I have opened the link but, too many link in it, and I am not F# user, so I do not know which one I should install, I think more info about requirement should be added in readme.md

body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13158903/65375034-630c6180-dcc3-11e9-9469-2015a03a134b.png)

(can not fix by scrolling screen or executing :redraw)

title: [Linux] mouse scroll jumps randomly
body:
Similar behavior as vscode (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/28795)

It is hard to fix it in this side, but I guess we can make a workaround by adding an addition checking for the scroll length... (like ignore scrolling when it too large)

title: Running fvim from start menu after fvim --setup doesn't start

Not sure why or how, but running fvim by pressing win key and typing fvim + enter doesn't start up fvim. However when I run it from the terminal it works great.

win 10

title: FVimFontLineHeight '0' will freeze or hang process sometimes
body:
I don't know why anyone would want 0 line height, but I see this issue when testing out the other issues.

Expected:
Line height goes to 0, everything looks weird. Can still use / input.

What happens:
Sometimes it freezes, can not input or see any render, but can close normally.
Sometimes the process hangs and cannot input anything and need to terminate process (ctrl alt del).

Reproduce:
1. Need to open decent size file, I use `fvim/ui.fs`
2. (Optional) Have decent line height already `:FVimFontLineHeight 'default'`
3. Set line height 0 `:FVimFontLineHeight '0'`
Sometimes will freeze, sometimes will hang
Sometimes will work (this is only true if file isn't big enough for me)

Btw I have decent speed machine (Ryzen 3600, 16GB memory, geforce 1050) 

Not big deal because I don't think anyone would set line height to 0 on purpose.
But maybe bug appears for real values but the difference in line height is too big?

title: Height clipping for certain glyphs & underline
body:
Related to #60 , the change is step in right direction since it fixes horizontal clipping last character for italics.

Change also introduce this new behavior:

![ezgif-4-9c682f7f71f8](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12157634/65152451-f9a3fe80-d9f5-11e9-95b3-9b913ec7ffeb.gif)

I confirmed undoing change in #60 will not do this, it _always_ will clip. So no different renders. Setting line height to +1.5 (for me) will fix clipping height.

After change in #60 I see there is the __possibility__ can fix height issue without need for line height setting. Problem now is it will revert on subsequent renders (or go back and forth). Setting line height to +1.5 for me will fix this too (no back and forth). But as shown in gif, it can render properly without need for line height.

Not shown is it affects underline too.

title: Undo --setup
body:
Is there a `--uninstall` option?

Not sure why, but ever since I ran `fvim --setup`, on every reboot, fvim pops up with a line saying `net start mavsc`. I'm getting the feeling that fvim associated itself as the default app for `.bat` files, and not they are getting opened in fvim instead at executed at startup?

title: Linux: Emojis not rendering
body:
On Linux, emoji characters are not rendering. I've installed `noto-fonts-emoji` which should be the default emoji font-face and ensured it's recognized

title: Linux: glyph under cursor is not synchronizing
fvim doesn't remember window position height
body:
For Windows 10, fvim does not remember last window position Y (or maybe it does but it adds to Y). ~~X is ok.~~

Not a big deal but figure to report the issue.

title: Airline colors wrong
body:
In nvim and nvim-qt I get perfectly fine airline colors, but in fvim I cannot.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3323631/64823605-b4eb1400-d56c-11e9-8d31-8747294a37d4.png)

Pictured is my init.vim configuration and the issue. Repeated below is my config.

if &compatible
  set nocompatible
endif

set runtimepath+=c:/dev/OneDrive/vim/dein/repos/github.com/Shougo/dein.vim

set guifont=Fira\ Code:h13

if dein#load_state('~/.cache/dein')
  call dein#begin('~/.cache/dein')

  call dein#add('~/.cache/dein/repos/github.com/Shougo/dein.vim')
  call dein#add('vim-airline/vim-airline')
  call dein#add('vim-airline/vim-airline-themes')
  call dein#add('morhetz/gruvbox')

  call dein#end()
  call dein#save_state()
endif

colorscheme gruvbox

let g:airline#extensions#tabline#enabled = 1
let g:airline_powerline_fonts = 1
let g:airline_theme='gruvbox'

filetype plugin indent on
set incsearch
set hlsearch
set ignorecase
set smartcase
set clipboard=unnamed

set t_Co=256
let &t_AB="\e[48;5;%dm"
let &t_AF="\e[38;5;%dm"

if exists('g:fvim_loaded')
  FVimFontAntialias v:true
  FVimFontAutohint v:true
  FVimFontSubpixel v:true
  FVimFontLcdRender v:true
  FVimFontHintLevel 'full'
  FVimFontAutoSnap v:true
endif

title: Possible weird state where :Explore freezes fvim
body:
`:Explore` working fine on fvim Windows 10 --wsl. Then one day `:Ex` will freeze every time. Restart fvim or Windows 10 doesn't fix. But CtrlP or `:e` work fine.

I figured out how to reproduce. It has something to do with conflicting default? dirs for neovim. 

1. Open neovim in WSL `$ nvim` in a terminal (no need to do anything after)
2. Create a Windows shortcut for fvim with --wsl (target Fvim.exe --wsl, Start in: empty) this should make default dir the Windows desktop dir or wherever you created shortcut)
3. Start fvim through shortcut, Do `:Ex` in fvim

Now it freezes, fvim will be in a bad state where it freezes everytime you `:Ex` no matter what dir you pick.

To fix, have to 'sync' with WSL neovim backend.
1. neovim in WSL do `:Ex <pick a dir>`
2. fvim do `:Ex <same dir as above>` 

Now everything works again. For me I can reproduce with these steps every time. Think it has something to do with fvim getting stuck on path translation once it sees an error (C:\ instead of /mnt/c).

Once you fix, the shortcut created no longer causes issues. Have to re-create a new shortcut to force the problem again and re-do all steps exactly.

Not sure why this is happening but its not great. Any hints for how to fix it?

title: Issues rendering italic and underlines
body:
![Untitled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12157634/64655381-1a6ac380-d3fa-11e9-8bdb-005e9dcdffb7.png)

Sorry for poor job on the pic but:
Top line is fvim
Bottom line is cmder / conemu running vim (nvim)

This is Windows 10, using same font (SF Mono), same vim config, same wsl / neovim. 

- Cuts off italic last letter
- Cuts off italic height of some letters (g in settings)
- Underlines swiggles aren't connected, has a dotted look to them and look poor quality

I tried different fonts:
- Consolas: italics ok has minor clipping except for underlines
- Source Code Pro: italics slightly clips but not bad at all, underlines still bad
- Fira Code: very bad clipping on italics and underline

I've tested fonts on other apps: Cmder (conemu) in the picture, tested with visual studio code, and emacs.

title: Long start up --wsl
body:
Great project, enjoy it a lot.

I get very long start ups, around 1-2 minutes when:
- first launch after Win10 boots (or reboots), Reproduce 100%; always happens
- after first launch, closing and opening is very fast, But still sometimes it still will take 1-2 minutes to launch again this is not common. Can't reproduce 100%.

When I first downloaded fvim, I thought it didn't work because it doesn't open... I realized I just need to wait.

~~Without `--wsl` it always starts fast.~~ It seems to have the same issue without --wsl.
Don't know how to debug further.

System: 
Win 10 x64 
WSL 1, ubuntu disco
neovim 0.3.4 (official package from disco repo)

title: Black screen / spinning beachball with the latest release
body: Hello, I've just downloaded the latest release of FVim (v0.2-96-g269872a) for the macOS. When I start it up, the whole application window remains black, it goes into "beachball mode" (unresponsive application) and need to force quit it. I usually download new releases of Fvim and never had any stability issues with it so far.

title: Pressing "super" key causes "none" to be entered
body:
OS: Arch Linux
window manager: i3

Whenever I press the "super" key (often bound to the windows key on a keyboard), fvim treats it as if I pressed the keys "n" "o" "n" "e", in that order. An example of this behavior, if I press the super key while in normal mode in an empty buffer, the buffer will look like
```

ne
```
Because the "n" will have no effect, the "o" will start insert mode on the next line, and then "ne" will be pressed while in insert mode.

This makes fvim unusable for me, since the "super" key is part of how I use i3.

I apologize if there is a specific format an issue should follow, I couldn't find anything like that in your readme/documentation. Lemme know if you need me to add things.

title: Implement rpm packaging
body: Should generate an rpm package alongside the deb linux package. Currently the rpm generation has been tested, but not the resulting rpm itself.

title: Improve linux installation instructions #52
body: Added a couple options in the Linux install instructions section to hopefully cover more cases.

title: Issue in the documentation regarding distribution
body: You state in the documentation, that dpkg ... .deb is the way to install fvim on Linux. This will not work on over 60 percent of all cases, since there are other distributions out there, next to .deb based ones.

title: Exception on Start - Arch Linux
body:
I'm currently running into an exception thrown on start on Arch Linux:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1017310/63281936-c138c580-c27b-11e9-8da2-7f07aae64128.png)

Seems to be related to font?

title: Can not input <C-h> on Windows
body:
I've the following line in my .vimrc to map <c-w>h to <c-h> but it's not seeming to work in fvim.

`nnoremap <C-h> <C-w>h`

title: Running multiple instances, launching from command line (macOS)
body:
Hello,

So far I was just launching the app by double-clicking the FVim.app that came with the dmg release. I was wondering if I could have several fvim processes with different projects (root workspace folders) in them? 

Is there way to launch multiple instances of fvim and/or launch it from the command line? The [launch options](https://github.com/yatli/fvim#startup-options) from readme give me some hint that it's possible.

title: Powerline not fluid
body: Hi! First of all thanks for this app! ### Description I'm running the lastest release (0.2) and my powerline symbols does show up but not as fuild as it is on nvim-qt or terminal. The problem seems to be that the colors are not being applied to the powerline extension, I suspect of that because, if I change the colorscheme on a running instance the editor changes its colors but the powerline does not, remaining on the previous colorscheme until restart with the new colorscheme set on `init.vim` ### Screenshots As comparison here is on Nvim-qt: ~~And it does happen with other themes even third party: (Nord for instance)~~ ### Configurations: - `ginit.vim` ``` if exists('g:fvim_loaded') " Ctrl-ScrollWheel for zooming in/out set guifont=Iosevka:h16 nnoremap :set guifont=+ nnoremap :set guifont=- nnoremap :call rpcnotify(1, 'ToggleFullScreen', 1) endif " Disable currently ugly popup menu that doenst receive customisation GuiPopupmenu 0 " Disable gui tabline, use vim's plugin one GuiTabline 0 call GuiWindowMaximized(1) ``` - `airline` ``` let g:airline#extensions#coc#enabled = 1 let g:airline#extensions#tabline#fnamemod = ':r.:e' let g:airline#extensions#tabline#enabled = 1 let g:airline#extensions#tabline#left_sep = ' ' let g:airline#extensions#tabline#left_alt_sep = '|' let g:airline#extensions#tabline#formatter = 'unique_tail' let g:airline_powerline_fonts = 1 " ``` ### Versions - title: Issues with keymaps on macOS
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Insert mode
1. type “backtick” (\`) char, equals ` = ` char, tilda ` ~ ` char or plus ` + ` char

Expected:

backtick, equals, tilda, or plus is written

Actual:

“none” is written for backtick and equals
nothing is written for tilda and plus

on my keyboard layout (standard en-US), tilda is accessed via <kbd>SHIFT</kbd>+<kbd>`</kbd> and plus is accessed via <kbd>SHIFT</kbd>+<kbd>+</kbd>

title: experiment blit with gpu
body:
the previous effort gives the result that blit is not as efficient as redrawing the text on CPU.
however, given that we've moved to accelerated graphics, things may have changed.
especially now that we are enabling ligature features, drawing text becomes slower sometimes.
we may want to keep better track of the drawn artifacts so that we can reuse them.

now I see why the text editors end up with span-like interface. :)

title: underline/undercurl disappear after switching color scheme
Dealing with Duplicate Entries due to multiple Claims Provider
body:
Hi Yvand,

This is a question more than a bug I think. We have some user entries in AzureAD which will share a number of details with the same users AD claim such as their email for example. When searching in a people picker field we require exact matches on AzureCP which we use to filter out the AD duplicates which works for searching.

However if you assign a user via People Picker to a field on a list item using their AD username. Save the list item, and then edit it again it then picks up the duplicate entries and asks the user to resolve. It will do this every time the user edits the list item which is non-ideal as not all users will correctly identify which one is the correct claim.

With the aim of solving this is there a way we can filter out duplicate entries from AzureAD without hindering the ability to share with guest users? I get the feeling I might be missing something really simple as we dont have this issue with previous claims providers on older instances.

title: Azure CP - Failing to claim access token reliably
body:
Hi Yvand, been using Azure CP on a pair of our farms and in the past month or so have started encountering the following error in our ULS logs with the people picker becoming unreliable when searching for Azure users;
 
"[AzureCP] Could not get access token before timeout of 15000ms for tenant 'example.onmicrosoft.com' on cloud instance 'ExampleInstance'"
 
This repeats about 7 or 8 times at which point it would then claim a token and work without issue for an hour. The same then repeats every time the token is refreshed. I updated a Pre-Prod instance to 19.0.20210211.1285 to take advantage of the advised improvements to token handling.
 
**Initial Token Claim after Update:**
The issue has persisted post upgrade on this Pre-Prod instance with the same behaviour and initial error. With some additional Graph related errors, we didn’t get these on the previous version.
 
**Before Claiming the Token, one instance of:**
"[AzureCP] Unexpected error occurred in Microsoft.Graph could not query tenant 'example.onmicrosoft.com': Microsoft.Graph.ServiceException: Code: InvalidAuthenticationToken  Message: Access token is empty.  Inner Error:  AdditionalData:  date: 2021…"

**After Claiming the Token, Four instances of:**

“[AzureCP] Unexpected error occurred Microsoft.Graph could not query tenant 'example.onmicrosoft.com': System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCanceledException: A task was canceled., Callstack:   
at System.Runtime.CompilerService.Task.Awaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
at System.Runtime.CompilerService.Task.Awaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification (Task task)
at Microsoft.Graph.HttpProvider.<SendRequestAsync.d__19.MoveNext

People Picker will fail to return results saying it can’t reach the server until a search is done after the token claim.

**When next claiming a token after an hour** 

The token takes 7 attempts once again to be claimed and new errors are presented by MicosoftGraph. These stop on their own if a new search is attempted.

**Six Instances of after token claim:**

[AzureCP] Unexpected error occurred Microsoft.Graph could not query tenant ‘example.onmicrosoft.com’: System.FormatException Cannot add value because header ‘Authorization’ does not support multiple values., Callstack:
at System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpHeaders.ParseAndAddValue(String name, HeaderStoreItemInfo info, String value)    
 at System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpHeaders.Add(String name, String value)    
 at azurecp.AADAppOnlyAuthenticationProvider.<AuthenticateRequestAsync>d__13.MoveNext()  --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---    
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()    
 at Microsoft.Graph.AuthenticationHandler.<SendRetryAsync>d__15.MoveNext()  --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---    
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()    
 at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)    
 at Microsoft.Graph.AuthenticationHandler.<SendAsync>d__16.MoveNext()  --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---    
 at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()    
 at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)    
 at Microsoft.Graph.HttpProvider.<SendRequestAsync>d__19.MoveNext()


Any insight or assistance that can be provided for this would be greatly appreciated.

title: applying security token provider on a new web application
body:
Hey  Yvand

I just linked my AzureAD  to a new web applications and followed the instruction of adding a provider realm as below

$ap = Get-SPTrustedIdentityTokenIssuer -Identity "AzureAD"
$uri = new-object System.Uri("https://www.something.com")
$ap.ProviderRealms.Add($uri, "https://www.something.com/_trust/")
$ap.Update()

but when connecting  to the new web application I am getting the below:

ID4037: The key needed to verify the signature could not be resolved from the following security key identifier 'SecurityKeyIdentifier
   (
   IsReadOnly = False,
   Count = 1,
   Clause[0] = X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause(RawData = XXXXXXXXXXX)  )

 Ensure that the SecurityTokenResolver is populated with the required key.

title: AzureCP configuration for guest users
body:
Hello,

we've configured our claim mapping in Azure based on Microsoft documentation like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2125129/107957036-536c7780-6fa0-11eb-9216-63031d40e530.png)

In AzureCP for guest user we had to change the User identitfier property to UserPrincipalName:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2125129/107957417-e0afcc00-6fa0-11eb-9200-12ca81c25412.png)

Sharing and access works fine but resources are shared to xyz_domain.com#ext#@ourdomain.onmicrosoft.com and not to the email address of the guest user (xyz@domain.com). This is ok but not that nice and somehow unusual for our SharePoint users.

Is it somehow possible to configure Azure and AzureCP in someway that resources are shared in a way to external guests so that only their email address or fullname is visible in the "Shared with" dialog?

title: Publish v19
body:
## Changelog

* Fix bug: No Azure AD group was returned when FilterSecurityEnabledGroupsOnly is set to true - https://github.com/Yvand/AzureCP/issues/109
* Fix bug: Setting "Filter out Guest users" in new AAD teant dialog excludes members instead of guests - https://github.com/Yvand/AzureCP/issues/107
* Add ConfigureAwait(false) to Task.WhenAll()
* Update the text in AzureCP global admin page
* Better handle scenario when AzureCP cannot get an access token for a tenant
* Update NuGet package Microsoft.Graph.3.19.0 -> Microsoft.Graph.3.23.0
* Update NuGet package Microsoft.Identity.Client.4.22.0 -> Microsoft.Identity.Client.4.25.0
* Update NuGet package NUnit.3.12.0 -> NUnit.3.13.1

title: People Picker unreliable, timeouts
body:
Hello,

we've enabled AzureCP for one web application three months ago. We notice that the people picker works very unreliable. Often times I have to retype the name I'm searching for multiple times before the results appear. Sometimes this takes a couple of minutes. When I get the results it will work fine for the next couple of hours (probably the results are chached?).

When no people are found I see this message in the ULS log for AzureCP:
[AzureCP] Could not get access token before timeout of 4000 ms for tenant 'XXX.onMicrosoft.com' on cloud instance 'AzurePublic'	9654a59f-XXXX

I added proxy configuration to all necessary web sites following the install guide. 

Any ideas?

title: UserLogin vs. UserName
body:
This isn't really an "issue" with the app (I don't think...), but more of a problem that we are having with implementation. The only way we have been able to get the display names to show up correctly (for instance, in the top right-hand corner of the SharePoint pages) is by setting the Unique Identifier in AzureCP to DisplayName. However, if we do that, it also changes the UserLogin values to i:0e.t\|azuread|<DisplayName>, which we do NOT want.

How do we get the user's Display Name to show up as their username, and still use their UPN for their UserLogin value?

title: Publish v18
body:
## Changelog

* IMPORTANT: due to its dependencies and issues specific to .NET 4.6.1 (and lower) with .NET Standard 2.0, AzureCP 18 requires at least .NET 4.7.2.
* Replace authentication library ADAL (deprecated) with MSAL.NET (recommended), using Nuget package Microsoft.Identity.Client 4.22.0
* Replace NuGet package Nito.AsyncEx.StrongNamed (outdated) with up to date Nuget package Nito.AsyncEx 5.1.0.
* Add support for national clouds
* Fix queries on multiple Azure AD tenants that were not actually made in parallel
* Add method ValidateEntities to allow developers to inspect the entities generated by AzureCP, and remove some before they are returned to SharePoint.
* Make users searchable by mail in the people picker
* Update NuGet package Microsoft.Graph.3.8.0 -> Microsoft.Graph.3.19.0
* Update NuGet package Microsoft.Graph.Core.1.20.1 -> Microsoft.Graph.Core.1.22.0
* Update NuGet package NUnit3TestAdapter.3.16.1 -> NUnit3TestAdapter.3.17.0
* Remove several useless NuGet packages and references

When we enable guest filter, then the people picker can't find any account from the second Azure AD. After disable the guest account filter, then the people picker shows all account from the second Azure AD.

title: Replace authentication library ADAL (deprecated) with MSAL.NET (recommended)
AzureCP timeout
body:
We are planning to move from ADFS to authentication trough Azure AD. Therefore we are moving from LDAPCP (ADFS) to AzureCP (Azure AD).

I've prepared the necessary setup in Azure AD and set up a new TrustedTokenIssuer in SharePoint. After that I enabled it in a web application and could successfully login with my Azure AD credentials and access a SP site.

After that I setup our tenant in Azure CP Global Configuration and do all the steps from the install guide. When I click on Test the Connection I get the message "Connection successful."

After I add the tenant login trough AzureAD will not work anymore. When I remove it, login will work again.

When I try to open a site I get the following error:
After 60 seconds I get redirected to a /_trust URL with a "Server Error in '/' Application." message.
When I look in the EventViewer I see the following message:
`Security Token Service timed out [Correlation ID : 786e869f-fa87-b07c-887f-afb9082dba70 ] with exception: System.TimeoutException: The request channel timed out while waiting for a reply after 00:00:59.7968640. Increase the timeout value passed to the call to Request or increase the SendTimeout value on the Binding. The time allotted to this operation may have been a portion of a longer timeout. ---> System.TimeoutException: The HTTP request to 'http://localhost:32843/SecurityTokenServiceApplication/securitytoken.svc' has exceeded the allotted timeout of 00:00:59.8740000. The time allotted to this operation may have been a portion of a longer timeout. ---> System.Net.WebException: The operation has timed out`

I've went trough the Troubleshoot section (On the SharePoint Server with the farm account)
1) Test Connectivity --- works fine
2) Obtain the access token using PowerShell --- works fine. I get a token
3) Check SharePoint logs --- It does produce any log file. Logging for AzureCP is set to Verbose

title: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Net.Http, Version=4.2.0.0, [...]' with version 17.0.20200618.1133
body:
I updated AzureCP from previously version 15.3.20191120.1028 to now 17.0.20200618.1133. Since then, I can no longer test the connection to Azure AD tenant in CA on the AzureCPSettings page. If I try so, a "File Not Found." error is raised. In the ULS log I see:

```
Application error when access /_admin/azurecp/AzureCPSettings.aspx, Error=Could not load file or assembly 'System.Net.Http, Version=4.2.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.  
 at azurecp.ControlTemplates.AzureCPGlobalSettings.<>c__DisplayClass12_0.<ValidateAzureTenantConnection>b__0()    
 at Microsoft.SharePoint.Utilities.SecurityContext.RunAsProcess(CodeToRunElevated secureCode)    
 at Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSecurity.RunWithElevatedPrivileges(WaitCallback secureCode, Object param)    
 at Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSecurity.RunWithElevatedPrivileges(CodeToRunElevated secureCode)    
 at System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.OnClick(EventArgs e)    
 at System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.RaisePostBackEvent(String eventArgument)    
 at System.Web.UI.Page.ProcessRequestMain(Boolean includeStagesBeforeAsyncPoint, Boolean includeStagesAfterAsyncPoint)
```

I did read that there was some troubleshooting done in issue https://github.com/Yvand/AzureCP/issues/86.

I cannot load the mentioned binary in PowerShell either:
```
> [System.Reflection.Assembly]::Load("System.Net.Http, Version=4.2.0.0, Culture=neutral,
 PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")
Exception calling "Load" with "1" argument(s): "Could not load file or assembly 'System.Net.Http, Version=4.2.0.0,
Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file
specified."
At line:1 char:1
+ [System.Reflection.Assembly]::Load("System.Net.Http, Version=4.2.0.0, ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [], MethodInvocationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : FileNotFoundException
```

However, I can load version 4.0.0.0:
```
> [System.Reflection.Assembly]::Load("System.Net.Http, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral,
 PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

GAC    Version        Location
---    -------        --------
True   v4.0.30319     C:\Windows\Microsoft.Net\assembly\GAC_MSIL\System.Net.Http\v4.0_4.0.0.0__b03f5f7f11d50a3a\Syst...
```

"C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\assembly\GAC_MSIL\System.Net.Http\v4.0_4.0.0.0__b03f5f7f11d50a3a\System.Net.Http.dll" has File and Product version 4.7.2634.0.
"C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v4.0.30319\clr.dll" has File and Product version 4.7.3650.0.

We use SharePoint Foundation 2013 on a Windows Server 2012 R2 server.

I did find another article saying that the error might be fixed by adding a bindingRedirect in web.config here:
https://coderjony.com/blogs/solution-could-not-load-file-or-assembly-systemnethttp-version-4200-culture-neutral-publickeytoken-b03f5f7f11d50a3a-or-one-of-its-dependencies-the-system-cannot-find-the-file-specified/

But if I have understood correctly, this is not a case with AzureCP, since it uses "_NuGet package Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory, which requires System.Net.Http (>= 4.3.4)_" (https://github.com/Yvand/AzureCP/issues/86#issuecomment-665502831). So, any other ideas? For the time being, I revert back to AzureCP 15.3.20191120.1028.

title: Quick question on AzureCP function
body:
Hi,
Is it possible to have the AzureCP work for 2 SharePoint WebApps that each authenticate against their own enterprise app in Azure Active Directory (same Azure Tenancy)?

I see that the documentation specifies that "Due to limitations of SharePoint API, do not associate AzureCP with more than 1 SPTrustedIdentityTokenIssuer" so I assume this will require development of the AzureCP solution to make this possible?

Alternatively, is it more simple to configure the Trusted identity Provider (in Azure AD & SharePoint) to work across both web applications and then continue to use the AzureCP against the 1 SPTrustedIdentityTokenIssuer that is now working on 2 web applications. In this scenario the user security would be assigned at the SharePoint level and not at the AzureAD App level?

The last section of the documentation details this second approach and it looks quite straight forward so I would assume it wouldn't create any issues for AzureCP
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/sharepoint-on-premises-tutorial

Best Regards
Lachlan

title: Publish v17
body:
## Changelog

* Fix error when earching users with a single quote in the people picker - https://github.com/Yvand/AzureCP/issues/88
* Use batch requests when relevant to optimize network performance
* Avoid potential null reference exception in method AzureCP.ProcessAzureADResults() and ensure that method AzureCP.QueryAzureADTenantAsync() never returns null
* Update target framework to v4.6.1
* Update NuGet package Microsoft.Graph 1.21.0 -> Microsoft.Graph 3.8.0
* Update NuGet package Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory 5.2.6 -> Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory 5.2.7

title: Searching users with a single quote in the people picker doesn't work
body:
Using AzureCP 16.0, in the people picker, you type a value with a single quote, for example: user', and it returns an error.
In the logs, AzureCP records this:

```
06/12/2020 09:54:22.11	w3wp.exe (0x1818)	0x0570	AzureCP	Lookup	1337	VerboseEx	[AzureCP] Querying Azure AD tenant 'TENANT.onMicrosoft.com' for users/groups/domains, with input 'user''	
06/12/2020 09:54:22.16	w3wp.exe (0x1818)	0x0570	AzureCP	Lookup	1337	Unexpected	[AzureCP] Unexpected error(s) occurred while querying Azure AD tenant 'TENANT.onMicrosoft.com':  [EXCEPTION 1]: Microsoft.Graph.ServiceException: Code: BadRequest  Message: Invalid filter clause  Inner error:
```

Cause:
Single quotes should be double escaped as documented in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/query-parameters#escaping-single-quotes

title: AzureCP is not able to find UPN in AzureAD
body:
hi Team,

I have performed integration of sharepoint wth AAD from https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/sharepoint-on-premises-tutorial#additional-resources link. But my testing is not successful.

Following is the details regarding my testing scenario.
Given - 
1. I have one sharepoint server and userId (firstname.lastname@domain.local), using this userId I can access sharepoint site internally without integrating with AAD.
2. I have created one application in AAD and have a userId(firstname.lastname@comapanyemail.com) and this userId has an UPN configured in "user.extensionattribute1" custom attribute.

Testing -

1. as per documentation when I set claims "name" and "unique identifier" with value "user.localuserprinciplename" then user is getting authenticated successfully but the home page of sharepoint is not as same as #1 in given part.
2. when I set claim "name" with value "user.extensionattribute1" then after login through AAD, SAML claims are getting sent to AzureCP, and AzureCP tries to find "firstname.lastname@domain.local" userId which it receives from claim "name" and tries searching it in AAD with value as "firstname.lastname@domain.local" and type as UPN, but as this value is not present in AAD as UPN then  AzureCP throws an error  saying found 0 record for this match.

Notes -
AzureCP is configured with default configuration as below : 
$realm = "urn:sharepoint:federation"
$wsfedurl="URL"
$filepath="certificate apth"
$cert = New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2($filepath)
New-SPTrustedRootAuthority -Name "AzureAD" -Certificate $cert
$map1 = New-SPClaimTypeMapping -IncomingClaimType "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name" -IncomingClaimTypeDisplayName "name" -LocalClaimType "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/upn"
$map2 = New-SPClaimTypeMapping -IncomingClaimType "http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2008/06/identity/claims/role" -IncomingClaimTypeDisplayName "Role" -SameAsIncoming
$ap = New-SPTrustedIdentityTokenIssuer -Name "AzureAD" -Description "Azure AD SharePoint server 201x" -realm $realm -ImportTrustCertificate $cert -ClaimsMappings $map1,$map2 -SignInUrl $wsfedurl -IdentifierClaim $map1.InputClaimType

Problem Identifier Path - 
I have identified from testing that if AzureCP searches for "mail" instead of "UPN" for value it received from claim "name" in SAML response from AAD then we'll be good for our testing to get passed.

For this I already tried editing AzureCP claims configuration but it is not getting edited successfully.

Could you please help checking on this part and let me know if you need any help on this.


Thanks
Abhishek

title: Additional Unique Identifiers?
body:
Is there any way to add an additional unique identifier? We do not use our On-Prem UPNs as the unique identifiers in Azure. We use the mail attribute. For SharePoint we use DOMAIN\username format, but would also be OK with using the ON-PREM UPNs (username@on-premisedomain.local). We have to use one of those two because we have custom code that needs to find the user using their domain name and username (those two attributes are stored in our HR database, whereas email addresses are not).

So, I'm wondering if there is a way to get AzureCP to use either DOMAIN\username or username@on-premdomain.local format for the unique identifier. Obviously the Azure Application would also need to be changed to return this information as well. I know Enterprise Applications are capable of this, but I'm not sure if the type of Azure Application AzureCP uses is capable of it. I do know both of these are stored on the AD accounts in Azure. It's just a matter at figuring out how to get to the data....

title: Certificate based authentication in Azure AD
body:
Current version of `AzureCP` uses `ApplicationSecret` to authenticate in Azure AD and acquire `AuthenticationHeader` for MS Graph.

```Powershell
# Add a new Azure AD tenant
$newAADTenant = New-Object azurecp.AzureTenant
$newAADTenant.Name = "xxx.onMicrosoft.com"
$newAADTenant.ApplicationId = "Application ID"
$newAADTenant.ApplicationSecret = "XXX"
$config.AzureTenants.Add($newAADTenant)
$config.Update()
```

Azure AD application page states

> For a higher level of assurance, we recommend using a certificate (instead of a client secret) as a credential.

Is there a way to use `certificate`-based authentication with `AzureCP`?

title: Question: FeadAuth cookie update / Access token renewal
body:
By default Azure AD generate Access token with 1 hour Lifetime.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/active-directory-configurable-token-lifetimes#configurable-token-lifetime-properties

This means that `FedAuth` cookie will be valid only for 1h.
(If you do not have `Azure AD Premium` for [Conditional Access](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/howto-conditional-access-session-lifetime#configuring-authentication-session-controls) )

Technically, SharePoint reply 401 on the first call after Access Token expiration.

In the same `Refresh Token Max Inactive Time` is 90 days. If I understand it correctly, this mean that new access token can be acquired using the old one during this time frame.

# The question

Is it possible to silently request token renewal from Azure AD (when token is close to expire, inside LogonTokenCacheExpirationWindow) and set new FedAuth cookie header in the response to make user's life happier?

title: Publish v15
body:
### Changelog

* Add a default mapping to populate the email of groups
* Update text in claims mapping page to better explain settings
* Add an option to return only security-enabled groups
* Update DevOps build pipelines
* Improve code quality as per Codacy's static code analysis
* Update NuGet package Microsoft.Graph to 1.15
* Update NuGet package Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory to 5.0.5
* Update NuGet package NUnit from 3.11 to 3.12
* Make most of public members privates and replace them with public properties, to meet best practices
* Use reflection to copy configuration objects, whenever possible, to avoid misses when new properties are added

title: Group membership doesn't calculate for Office groups (Unified groups/O365 Groups)
body:
Running v13 on SharePoint 2016.

Added an Office 365 Group (Unified Group) to any ACL (item, list, site, web app policy), and no one who is a member of that group can access the resource. Security groups work fine, but figured that since SPO can handle O365 Groups, then maybe on-prem can, as well.

After enabling verbose logging, I discovered that AzureCP only augments a claim with groups that are security-enabled. Fortunately, I had enough permissions on my Azure tenant to do this:

    $group = Get-AzureADMSGroup -SearchString 'name of group'
    Set-AzureADMSGroup -Id $group.Id -SecurityEnabled:$true

Once I security-enabled the group, AzureCP started picking up that group in claims augmentation.

Not sure how this should be handled moving forward...allow filtering of non-security-enabled groups? Flag non-security-enabled groups with a prefix/suffix? Just a documentation update?

title: Change User identifier property using PowerShell
body:
Hi Yvand,

Is it possible to change the "User identifier for 'Guest' users" setting in the global configuration of AzureCP using PowerShell?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5260349/52978506-5ec25200-341d-11e9-9a1f-f6fa1e363826.png)

I am working on a PowerShell script to switch the User Identifier to Mail then add the user using the mail attribute to the site collection, once complete then switch the User Identifier back to UserPrincipalName.

I am able to switch the User Identifier to Mail by running the following PowerShell to reset the claims config:
`Add-Type -AssemblyName "AzureCP, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=65dc6b5903b51636"
$config = [azurecp.AzureCPConfig]::GetConfiguration("AzureCPConfig")
$config.ResetClaimTypesList()

title: Hybrid Search does not support SAML based authentication
body:
There is a limitation in Hybrid Search where any objects with SAML based permissions submitted to SharePoint Online Search index are security trimmed. 

This causes these SharePoint objects to be unsearchable when authenticating with AzureAD.

Reference (Hybrid Search supports Windows Claims only): https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/spses/2016/07/19/sharepoint-2016-hybrid-search-stuff-you-should-know-about-cloud-ssa/ 

Please vote to to make this a priority for the Microsoft product development team: https://sharepoint.uservoice.com/forums/282887-sharepoint-hybrid-or-migration-to-office365/suggestions/20037220-support-hybrid-search-on-premise-with-a-saml-authe

title: Feature request to help support Multi-Tenant scenarios
body: We have started using this to support Multitenant deployments where each tenant has its own AzureAD Tenant for showing people to pick from, and at the moment we are making custom packages inheriting from the base AzureCP and overriding the CheckIfShouldProcessInput method to add a hardcoded filter against the context parameter.  This works great to limit the people pickers output based on the tenant url to just their AzureAD, but for every new tenant we bring on board, we need to create a new custom AzureCP with a *hardcoded URL* to filter by.  What I would like to ask for an upcoming version would be an additional data string field on the IAzureCPConfiguration so that we could actually pass in additional data from the settings UI, so then we could put in some JSON or simply the specific tenants URL in this case, and then we can use that in custom implementations versus hardcoding.  I realize I would still need to make custom packages for each tenant but I could then make AzureCPCustom01 - 50, deploy them all at once and deploy in a new farm and then our Ops guys just need to go in and configure each adding an extra bit of information (the url) as they bring new tenants online over time reducing our need to wait for outage windows (since deploying the hardcoded tenant version restarts the farm).

title: Publish v13
body:
## AzureCP v13 enhancements & bug-fixes

* Guest users are now fully supported. By default, AzureCP will use the Mail property to search Guest accounts and create their permissions in SharePoint
* The identity claim type set in the SPTrustedIdentityTokenIssuer is now automatically detected and associated with the property UserPrincipalName
* Fixed no result returned under high load, caused by a thread safety issue where the same filter was used in all threads regardless of the actual input
* Improved validation of changes made to ClaimTypes collection
* Added method ClaimTypeConfigCollection.GetByClaimType()
* Implemented unit tests
* Explicitly encode HTML messages shown in admin pages and rendered from server side code to comply with tools scanning code to detect security vulnerabilities
* Fixed display text of groups that were not using the expected format "(GROUP) groupname"
* Deactivating farm-scoped feature "AzureCP" removes the claims provider from the farm, but it does not delete its configuration anymore. Configuration is now deleted when feature is uninstalled (typically when retracting the solution)
* Added user identifier properties in global configuration page

title: Publish AzureCP v12
body:
## About this release

This release introduces a lot of changes and improvements, and moved away from the old Azure AD Graph API to the unified Microsoft Graph.
> **Important:** This version has breaking changes, please [check this page](https://yvand.github.io/AzureCP/Update-AzureCP.html) if you update from an earlier version.

## Changelog
- Improved: AzureCP now uses the unified [Microsoft Graph API](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/) instead of the old [Azure AD Graph API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/active-directory-graph-api).
- New: AzureCP can be entirely configured with PowerShell, including claim types configuration
- Updated: AzureCP administration pages are now created as User Controls and are reusable by developers.
- Improved: AzureCP claims mapping page is easier to understand
- Updated: Logging is more relevant and generates less messages.
- New: Timeout of connection is 4 secs and can be customized
- Improved: When multiple tenants are set, they are queried in parallel
- Updated: Tenant ID is no longer needed to register a tenant
- Improved: Nested groups are now supported, if group permissions are created using the ID of groups (new default setting).
- **Beaking change**: By default, AzureCP now creates group permissions using the Id of the group instead of its name (group IDs are unique, not names). There are 2 ways to deal with this: Modify group claim type configuration to reuse the name, or migrate existing groups permissions to set their values with their group ID
- **Beaking change**: Due to the amount of changes in this area, the claim types configuration will be reset if you update from an earlier version.
- Many bug fixes and optimizations

title: Migrate to microsoft graph
body:
## Changelog
- Improved: AzureCP now uses the unified [Microsoft Graph API](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/) instead of the old [Azure AD Graph API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/active-directory-graph-api).
- New: AzureCP can be entirely configured with PowerShell, including claim types configuration
- Updated: AzureCP administration pages are now created as User Controls and are reusable by developers.
- Improved: AzureCP claims mapping page is easier to understand
- Updated: Logging is more relevant and generates less messages.
- New: Timeout of connection is 4 secs and can be customized
- Improved: When multiple tenants are set, they are queried in parallel
- Updated: Tenant ID is no longer needed to register a tenant
- Improved: Nested groups are now supported, if group permissions are created using the ID of groups (new default setting).
- **Beaking change**: By default, AzureCP now creates group permissions using the Id of the group instead of its name (group IDs are unique, not names). There are 2 ways to deal with this: Modify group claim type configuration to reuse the name, or migrate existing groups permissions to set their values with their group ID
- **Beaking change**: Due to the amount of changes in this area, the claim types configuration will be reset if you update from an earlier version.

I have one web application using ADFS authentication, I have a Trusted Identity Provider for that. Everything works fine with LdapCP.
I have a second web application in the same SharePoint farm where I want to authenticate Azure AD users.
Is it possible to create a second Trusted Identity Provider and use AzureCP to retrieve Azure AD users in the people picker ? Or can I configure LdapCP and AzureCP in the same Trusted Identity Provider ?

Thanks in advance.

title: Publish AzureCP v11
body:
- Add possibility to filter out users that are not ["Member"](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/active-directory-b2b-user-properties) of the AAD tenant
- All users that are not members and have their mail matching a domain registered in the AAD tenant are systematically filtered out

title: Publish AzureCP v10
body:
- Fixed async management
- Added locking when setting access token 
- Implemented retry while getting group membership

title: Get Verified Domains and Skip Shadow Users
body:
Good evening,

I were able to prepare some code that compiles correctly.
Unfortunatly i am not able to test the result as:
- i can't sign the assembly (complains that Nito.AsyncEx is not strong named)
- i suppose the assembly should be in the GAC to be used by sharepoint

Nevertheless i think the logic to filter shadow accounts is sound (naturaly i did it :D).

Would consider merging it in AzureCP?

Cédric

PS: this is one part of the issue #8 i raised.

title: Multiple tenant and invitation APIs
body:
Hello,

When working with multiple tenants, the invitations process and api can generate confusion.

If Sharepoint is linked with one tenant:
- multiple result on lookup: invited users and native users in their tenant.
- inviting a user from another tenant does not work until the user is properly invited.
- previous question is valid on inviting a group (role)

What would you think of the proposition to:
- integrate azure ad invatitation api (users and groups).
- detect correlation between guest accounts (shadow users from primary tennant) and primary account in another tennant (configured in azurecp). So that only the primary account is shown.

thanks for the usefull tool!

Cédric

title: ACS Retirement
body: With Microsoft announcing the retirement of ACS for November 2018, have you looked at migration options to authenticate directly with Azure AD, bypassing ACS?

title: v2017-11
body:
- Improved async operations to make AzureCP a lot more reliable and faster
- Improved logging to record less and more relevant messages
- Removed use of privilege elevation

title: Configuration for all account types
body:
Hi, I am having trouble with getting the solution to work with all type of users within azure AD.

Currently we have the AzureCP configured to map claims/upn to property to query: mail.
This allows the following account types to login/resolve:
-Guest Users within a Federated Directory (B2B user with ADFS on their side)
-Guest User without a Federated Directory (B2B user without ADFS)
-AAD Security group roles
This configuration however **does not work** with:
-Local accounts created with an onmicrosoft.com address i.e someone@tenant.onmicrosoft.com

When configured as default (claims/upn mapped to query UPN):
Accounts that work:
-Local accounts created with an onmicrosoft.com address i.e someone@tenant.onmicrosoft.com
-Guest Users within a Federated Directory (B2B user with ADFS on their side)
Accounts that **don't work**:
-Guest User without a Federated Directory (B2B user without ADFS)

Can you confirm this is a limitation or is their a configuration change that can be made to have all account types work?

Regards
Ben.

We encountered with following issue for you to advice:

    - Normal user account are at domain B

title: Is it possible to filter out specific users via LDAPCP with an LDAPFILTER
body:
I'm not sure this is the right place to ask this question, if not let me know.

I want to ask if it's possible and how to filter out specific users via LDAP filter
Our company want's to hide users for example in the People Picker which have the AD attribute extensionAttribute11 set to 1.

We have SharePoint 2016 with ADFS and LDAPCP 14.1.20191007.981 and I've created an LDAP filter that is working via PowerShell, but I don't know how te set this in LDAPCP, I've tried to set this LDAP filter in the claims type configuration from the UPN claim, but this is probable not correct and it is also not working.

I've tried to find different forums, but I haven't found anything helpful. So that is way I'm asking here.

Can anyone tell me if it's possible to use such a LDAP filter in LDAPCP?
This is the LDAP filter that I want to use:  (&(objectClass=user)(extensionAttribute11=0))

We also have a SharePoint farm with NTLM authentication and there I was able to put the filter on the WebApp and that is working fine, because we use ADFS authentication and LDAPCP on this farm I'm supposed I have to set the filter someway via LDAPCP.

I hope some can help me in the right direction, thanks in advance!

title: Group Claim Augmentation does not work if display name is different from SamAccountName for Group
body:
When I try to provide access to users using an AD Group. My AD Group name is 'IT-DepartmentName'. But the display name is 'Department Name'.

So, while logging in, although claims augmentation is completed successfully, it does not match my group SamAccountName. Since during claims augmentation, it resolves to group display name and I never get access to the site due to the mis-match in Group display name vs Group SamAccountName.

title: Nested groups in AD, and .NET helper slowness
body:
Hello, 

We have an ADFS solution with LDAPCP installed on SharePoint 2016. Group augmentation with the .NET Helper to the SharePoint AD domain is working as expected with nested groups. However, the augmentation queries are taking on average 8-9 seconds. When running workflows against items on a list, we may see many of these group augmentation calls, which can extend steps that should be nearly instantaneous out to minutes.

When we uncheck the .NET Helper option, the LDAP failover query takes ~45ms on average, but does not return the nested security groups.

The relevant (redacted) output from the logs for each query:
[LDAPCP] Got 23 group(s) for user "--------" in 45 ms from LDAP server "LDAP://---.----.---/DC=---,DC=----,DC=---" with LDAP filter "(&(ObjectClass=user) (sAMAccountName=--------)(!(objectClass=computer)))" (authenticate as "process identity" with AuthenticationType "Secure, Signing, Sealing").

[LDAPCP] Got and processed 31 group(s) for user "--------" in 8158 ms from AD domain "---.----.---" (authenticate as "process identity" with AuthenticationType "SimpleBind, Signing, Sealing").

title: Question: Role claim configuration
body:
Dear Ywan,
I reach out to you once again for your input.
Building on the scenario I described in #124 

The SharePoint farm and external users are in Domain 1
The internal users are in Domain 2

I want to give read access for all internal users in Domain 2 by adding a Role Claim to the SharePoint visitors-group.
If user have role-claim "R-App-SharePoint" then grant permission.

ADFS is currently configured
ADFS server “adfs-domain2.com”, have a rule that adds role-claim with value "R-App-SharePoint" if user is member of "DOMAIN2\R-App-Sharepoint" on relying party "fs.domain2.com"

On relying party “fs.domain2.com” the following is configured:
1. Added rule on claim providers to "adfs.domain2.com" that all role-claims that starts with "R-App-SharePoint" shall be forwarded.
2. Added rule on relying party "sharepoint.domain2.com" that it shall forward all role-claims with value "R-App-SharePoint" (This is the RP that is used as URN in SharePoint)

The reason for this configuration is because we do not want to send all groups as claims, as external users could see them.

I have activated Augmentation in global configuration, but peopepicker does not resolve role claim "R-App-SharePoint". I was hoping to add this claim to the visitors-group. 

Augmetation activated: (not sure what .net-helper is but activated it just in case...)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67652786/89396953-825f8200-d70f-11ea-86ef-460014a705dc.png)

Trying to add role claim to visitors gorup (Norwegian:)

Would this setup work? :/ 
Really appreciate your help. I'm a ldap noob!

title: LDAPS path not working
body:
Hi Yvan,
This is more a question than an issue.
We are trying to connect LDAPCP a remote AD that's not on the same domain as SharePoint.
We're using the LDAPS protocol. 

We've tried the possible combination, none of them worked. The combinations are as follows : 
- LDAP**S**://<remote_server_ip>
- LDAP**S**://<remote_server_ip>/DC=<domain1>,DC=<domain2>
- LDAP**S**://<remote_server_ip>**:636**
- LDAP**S**://<remote_server_ip>**:636**/DC=<domain1>,DC=<domain2>
Removing the 'S' from LDAP : 
- LDAP://<remote_server_ip>:**636**
- LDAP://<remote_server_ip>:**636**/DC=<domain1>,DC=<domain2>

We also tried these combinations with the check-boxes "Secure", "Sealed", "Encryption" and "Signing".
Only the following path worked : 
LDAP://<remote_server_ip> or LDAP://<remote_server_ip>:389

The questions is : does LDAPCP supports LDAPS protocol ?

Thanks.
Khalil.

title: Connect to other domain
body:
Hi there,
I have the following setup:
A SharePoint 2019 farm with a colab-portal and a mysite-portal.
It has two User Profile Service connections setup. Both uses Trusted Identity Claim Provider to sync users from different domain.
Lets call them:
- SharePoint.local
- External.com

After installing LDAPCP I get results from sharepoint.local domain which the SharePoint servers are connected to.
I then added ldap://external.com domain in hope that the people picker would resolve external users awell, but unfortunately not. People picker only shows the sharepoint.local domain users.

When I try to invite a user from external.com, I am presented with the errormessage:
"This site cannot be shared with external users" even tho I have activated the functionality to share the site from "site settings -> users and groups -> settings for access requests"
I removing LDAPCP from the trustedidentityprovider to verify that this functionality works, and it does.

The user profile service works fine tho. I can see that all the users are synched fine. 
Do you have any pointers for me to go on? 

Also: Is there a way to get LDAPCP to only show users from the OU that the UPA is synchronizing? 
Grateful for any input on this issue :) (and sorry if this question seems stupid, Im a ldap novice...)

Best regards Mathias

title: UserAccountDirectoryPath is ignored?
body:
Hi Yvand!
I need users only from a specific OU for a site collection and OU varies between site collections. It seems that LDAPCP is ignoring an SPSite's _UserAccountDirectoryPath_ property. Is this true? If yes, is there any other way to set a specific OU for site collection. I'm using LDAPCP 14.1.20191007.981 and SharePoint 2019.

Set-SPSite -Identity http://portal.contoso.com/sites/US -UserAccountDirectoryPath "OU=US,OU=SharePoint,DC=Contoso,DC=com"

title: Custom Solution Inheriting LDAPCP not being recognized in Central Admin SharePoint 2019
body: We have a custom solution inheriting LDACP that works correctly in SharePoint 2013. When deploying to SharePoint 2019, the solution appears to install and deploy correctly and can associate with Trusted Provider in Powershell. However, when going to Central Admin, it shows only LDAPCP being registered, missing our custom extension. It also states that LDAPCP is not associated with a trusted provider, which is correct, because our custom extension is associated with the trusted provider.

title: ldapcp, ADFS and Office Online Server
body:
Hi @Yvand ,

I need your point of view for my case.

We have the following infrastructure and configuration :
- SharePoint 2016 servers
- ADFS server for SSO : ( a custom Trusted Identity Token Issuer )
- Office Online Server

What we did : 
- Create a new web app that have another trusted identity token issuer that has LDAPCP as claimprovider
- Configure the new web app with the new trusted identity provider 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361028/84051296-37dfb480-a9af-11ea-928e-7eda165003a3.png)

The problem we're facing : 
- In order for the new web app sites to authenticate through the new trusted identity provider, we needed to add the "?trust=LDAPCPConnect" param to the "Custom sign in page url"
![2020-06-08 17_40_29-Window](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361028/84051449-7a08f600-a9af-11ea-9127-b0edf2c6c51a.png)
- Once the param added, the sign is experience works perfectly. However, when we try to open an Excel or Word file on the desktop app, a blank authentication form appears and authentication process is blocked.
- If we remove the "?trust=LDAPCPConnect" param, Excel and Word files opens successfully on desktop apps but web app sites won't authenticate through "LDAPCPConnect" trusted identity provider.

Any idea on how to fix this problem ? If not, do you have any workaround ?

Thanks in advance.

title: Sharepoint 2019 - LDACP strange behaviour with groups
body:
Hi, 
We have a strange behaviour with groups (from augmentation).

Users comes from ADFS and claims provide groups membership (marked as role).
Groups comes from ldapcp which populate this group with role claims.

If I allow a "role group" to modify a document, it works. All users can access and modify. Permission seem's to be ok.

If I purpose to coediting the document with Office online, it fails. User can see the document, begin edition and an error message blocks all edition, random time.
If I check autorisation from Site Collection authorization, users has no authorisation.

Any idea?

I try to run the powershell script (imagine that user Jim has the issue on the Site Collection test) on a user which have issue.

$cs = [Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebService]::ContentService
$cs.TokenTimeout = New-TimeSpan -Minutes 1
$cs.Update()
$web = Get-SPWeb "http://spsites/test"
$logon = "i:05.t|contoso.local|jim@contoso.local"
$web.DoesUserHavePermissions($logon, [Microsoft.SharePoint.SPBasePermissions]::EditListItems)

title: Multiple Entries Found Cannot Add Certain User Objects
body:
[LDAPCP] Validation failed: found 2 entities instead of 1 for incoming claim with value 'test_user'

This triggers an exception in SharePoint stating that the username does not exist or is not unique.

It appears that my LDAPCP solutions is finding multiple entities on any site we create.

These user objects are not present on the existing site at all.

Any idea what might be causing this issue?

**Note:** we are using custom claims provider via our 3rd party IDP which pulls over user attributes via API call to display in the people picker.

**Note:** this does not happen to all attributes, only to those that look similar for example, test_user, test_usertest could trigger this behavior.

**Note:** We can replicate this on any existing site or newly created site.

title: Help for multiple TokenIssuer needed
body:
Hi everyone, here is a small call for help  ;-)
We have a SharePoint 2019 attached to three active directories via ADFS and with three SPTrustedIdentityTokenIssuer.
Now we want to implement the lookup into all three AD via LDAPCP.
In the section "For developers" on ldapcp.com I found the line
    "Use LDAPCP with multiple SPTrustedIdentityTokenIssuer."
that suggests, it's possible. But the message after that
    "Each class inheriting LDAPCP is a unique claims provider, and only 1 can be installed at a time by the feature event receiver."
is one I dont understand.
In  [Issue#94](https://github.com/Yvand/LDAPCP/issues/94) it seems @tah78 has made it, but how? Has anyone a guidance/example/documentation for me to extend LDAPCP and how to deal with this event receiver line above?

That would be great!

Okeo

PS: And yes, after a long search, I found LDAPCP.Developers.zip (in release v11 and not in "[each release](https://ldapcp.com/For-Developers.html)" ;-)  and I found LDAPCP.custom but I could not find the answer to the event receiver....

@Yvand : Thanks for your project here! Your work is the reason I'm trying at least  ;-)

title: stsadm -o deleteconfigurationobject supportability concern
body:
As a general FYI, running this command is a BIG RISK, and is UNSUPPORTED without a blessing from Microsoft support. There needs to be a warning on the fix issues page about this command. 
stsadm -o deleteconfigurationobject -id 5D306A02-A262-48AC-8C44-BDB927620227

Example: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/archive/blogs/okoestner/how-to-delete-a-timer-job-definition

It looks like the stsadm reference is no longer available.

title: Get Error "Sorry, you are not allowed to share this with external users"
body:
We installt LDAPCP 14.1 on SharePoint 2013. We connected to a ActiveDirectory Forrest. 

when I search for a user in the People Picker I get the error message "Sorry, you are not allowed to share this with external users"

I search for kxxxx@cos.com this is the value into the field "mail" 
ldapcp does not search in the "mail" field and we get the error messages

if I search for the value "kxxx@one.com", the account is found in the AD. The value is in the field" upn "

If I search vor name, the account is found. 

Only if i search for mail, we get the error. 

Value on AD site: 
mail="kxxxx@cos.com" -> search -> faild
upn="kxxx@one.com" -> search -> passed

on our LDAPCP Config, LDAPCP search only in the field "displayname; cn;sn;givenname and UPN) 

it is possible to configure ldapcp so that the "mail" field can also be searched

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59538522/71784814-0033a180-2ff8-11ea-86fd-834ec585a096.png)

Greeting
Mario

title: Unable to filter AD groups by Organization Unit
body:
Is there any filter to show only AD groups from selected OU's ? 

I have done all the user&group filtering based on these syntaxes I found here: https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/5392.active-directory-ldap-syntax-filters.aspx

However I cannot find any solution to filter based by OU.

Temporarily we have added an extensionattribute to all the AD groups we want to show in People Picker and then added this filter to groups in LDAPCP: (&(objectClass=group)(extensionAttribute2=someword*))

One way would be to add all those AD groups to one "master"-AD group and then probaly use the memberof-filter. Unfortunately that's not an option for various reasons according to our client.

Is there any other way?

title: Publish v14.1
body:
## LDAPCP 14.1.20191007.981 enhancements & bug-fixes - Published in October 7, 2019

* Fix regression: after installing v14, users are stuck in SharePoint just after sign-in to ADFS. https://github.com/Yvand/LDAPCP/issues/99

title: Unable to search by displayName
body:
Hi @Yvand 

We are unable to search users by their displayName, if change LDAP class value of "User identifier properties" to some other value.

So, I have added two connection strings - one is of our AD and another one is of LDAP. and there is this "User identifier properties" setting and their defaults values are **user** for class and **mail** for attributes. But in our LDAP there is no such object class as **user** and hence search query on LDAP directory doesn't work.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20821391/65880868-1ce48b80-e3b0-11e9-850b-652e327cb904.png)

title: DirectoryServicesCOMException - Unexpected error occurred while getting domain names information
body:
Randomly, LDAPCP fails to get domain names information and records the following error:

```
07/18/2019 13:58:53.78	w3wp.exe (0x22A0)	0x1AE8	LDAPCP	Configuration	1337	Unexpected	[LDAPCP] Unexpected error occurred while getting domain names information for LDAP connection LDAP://contoso.local/DC=contoso,DC=local: System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryServicesCOMException: An operations error occurred.  , Callstack:   
at System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry.Bind(Boolean throwIfFail)    
at System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry.Bind()    
at System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry.get_AdsObject()    
at System.DirectoryServices.PropertyCollection.Contains(String propertyName)    
at ldapcp.OperationContext.GetDomainInformation(DirectoryEntry directory, String& domainName, String& domainFQDN)    
at ldapcp.LDAPCP.SetLDAPConnection(Uri currentContext, LDAPConnection ldapConnection)
```

As a consequence, entities that use dynamic domain name tokens are missing the domain name.
For example, entity value will be "\groupName" instead of "contoso.local\groupName"

title: Publish v13
body:
### Changelog

* Add a default mapping to populate the email of groups
* Update text in claims mapping page to better explain settings
* Fix bug: During augmentation, PrincipalContext is not built with expected ContextOptions if LDAPConnection.UseSPServerConnectionToAD is true
* Improve logging during augmentation
* Improve logging when testing augmentation doesn't return expected result
* Update DevOps build pipelines
* Improve code quality as per Codacy's static code analysis
* Update NuGet package NUnit from 3.11 to 3.12
* Make most of public members privates and replace them with public properties, to meet best practices
* Use reflection to copy configuration objects, whenever possible, to avoid misses when new properties are added

title: Publish v11
body:
## LDAPCP v11 enhancements & bug-fixes - Published in August 30, 2018

* Fixed no result returned under high load, caused by a thread safety issue where the same filter was used in all threads regardless of the actual input
* Fixed the augmentation that randomly failed under high load, caused by a thread safety issue on list ILDAPCPConfiguration.LDAPConnectionsProp
* Added handling of special characters for LDAP filters as documented in https://ldap.com/ldap-filters/
* Added the first nae (givenName) in the list of attributes queried by default
* Improved validation of changes made to ClaimTypes collection
* Added method ClaimTypeConfigCollection.GetByClaimType()
* Implemented unit tests
* Explicitely encode HTML messages shown in admin pages and renderred from server side code to comply with tools scanning code to detect security vulnerabilities
* Deactivating farm-scoped feature "LDAPCP" removes the claims provider from the farm, but it does not delete its configuration anymore. Configuration is now deleted when feature is uninstalled (typically when retracting the solution)
* Added user identifier properties in global configuration page

title: How to configure: "Set a keyword to bypass LDAP lookup"
body:
How to configure the following?

**Set a keyword to bypass LDAP lookup**. e.g. input "extuser:partner@contoso.com" directly creates permission "partner@contoso.com" on claim type set for this.

title: Publish v10
body:
## About this release

This release introduces a lot of changes and improvements.
> **Important:** This version has breaking changes, please [check this page](https://ldapcp.com/Update-LDAPCP.html) if you update from an earlier version.

## Changelog
- LDAPCP can be entirely [configured with PowerShell](https://ldapcp.com/Configure-LDAPCP.html), including claim types configuration
- LDAPCP administration pages were updated to be easier to udnerstand, especially the page that configures claim types.
- LDAPCP administration pages can now be easily reused by developers.
- Augmentation can now handle multiple group claim types, and uses the credentials set when LDAP connection was added.
- Number of results returned by LDAP servers is now limited to improve performance of LDAP servers.
- Logging is more relevant and generates less messages.
- **Beaking change**: Due to the amount of changes in this area, the claim types configuration will be reset if you update from an earlier version.
- Many bug fixes and optimizations

title: Possible encoding problem with groups
body:
We recently made it possible for users to search/grant access on the basis of groups. For some groups it works like a charm, but others were not found.

It seems all groups starting with 0-9 or  A-F after the \-character (corresponding to valid ASCII-characters) can not be searched, as soon as one starts to type a letter after the \-character. This looks like a problem with the escaping/encoding of the \-character. Is it possible to fix this issue?

Example:
groups with the name xy\ba-* exist and can be found and used by typing "xy\", but as soon as one types "xy\b" they disappear.

title: Assigning SharePoint permission using other attributes with LDAPCP
body:
Hello @Yvand ,

We need your suggestion on below:

**Scenario:**
We have some SharePoint sites that are accessible to all in the organization as well as accessible to external users via default group 'Everyone'

**Requirement:**
Now there are some sites that shouldn't be accessible to external users, but should be accessible to members within the organizations. For this case the default group of Everyone doesn't help.

We know permission in SharePoint can be assigned via userID, Security AD group or default group like Everyone.

We would like to know if it it possible to assign permission on SharePoint based on “OUs”, “AD attribute” or “Wildcards” using **LDAPCP**.


**Examples:**
1.	Assign permissions to all users of a particular OU. If there are different OUs for employees and external users.
2.	Allow access to all users who have AD attribute “employeeType=Employee”
3.	Allow access to all users who have userid starting with “X-****”

Awaiting your reply. Thanks.

One other thing I noticed. When I go to the global configuration page and click "Ok" (without changing anything), I get the following error:

Sorry, something went wrong 
An update conflict has occurred, and you must re-try this action. The object LDAPCPConfig Name=LdapcpConfig was updated by [user], in the w3wp (7292) process, on machine [server name].  View the tracing log for more information about the conflict. 

Thanks.

title: LDAPCP and securitytoken.svc timeout
body:
Hi Yvan

We are experiencing this issue where users inteminnently are getting HTTP error 500 with message "The server is busy now. Try again later".
This happens after user is authenticatet and redirected to https://site/_trust/ 

In ULS I can see that calls to securitytoken.svc time out after 60 sec. It happens on both frontends.
The servers are not under pressure, doesn't look like a hardware capacity issue. Restarting SecurityTokenServiceAppPool seem to help but not for a long period.

This farm is using LDAPCP, and I'm wondering if our LDAPCP's configuration somehow contribute to the issue, specially the augmentation part of it. 

- LDAPCP the only thing that is unique comparing to other farms
 
- Users can be members of up to 500 AD groups 

- The token issued by ADFS contains claim "Role" with users group membership, but this is ignored and LDAPCP augmentation of "Role" is used, getting the same memberships from identity providers directly using LDAP

- Can see LDAP errors occuring in ULS, LDAP timeouts or LDAP Unknown error (0x8000500c). Usually when it happens users get "This page is not shared with you..." message

Is there anything with this configuration and symptoms that can cause securitytoken.svc timeouts when converting external to internal token og should I search for a solution somewhere else?


**:: Sharepoint configuration**

- Sharepoint 2016 RTM on Windows Server 2016
- Using claims authentication
- Federation provider: ADFS
- Identity providers: 2 active directories AD.DOMAIN1.ORG and AD.DOMAIN2.ORG
- Claim provider: LDAPCP
- Identity claim: UPN


**:: LDAPCP configuration**

- LDAP connections:

LDAP://AD.DOMAIN2.ORG (used for groups augmentation in DOMAIN2)

- Augmentation: Enabled

- Augmented Group Claim Type: http://schemas.microsoft.com/ws/2008/06/identity/claims/role 

- LDAP connections used for augmentation ("This is an AD server" selected): 
LDAP://OU=Groups,DC=AD,DC=DOMAIN1,DC=ORG

title: Bypass lookup for NTLM accounts
body:
Our environment is set up to use ADFS with LDAPCP. I set the people picker so it doesn't query our NTLM AD. I set a bypass lookup so we can add external users to SP. Everything is working good.

However, I realized we have a special circumstance where I need to be able to add an NTLM user to SP permissions. I thought I could use the bypass prefix to avoid name resolution but it adds the ADFS prefix to the account when I add the permissions:
 
 i:05.t|adfs|dmz\userName

I would like it to add it like so:

 dmz\userName
 
is this possible? Can I create a special claim in SP and set LDAPCP to do this?

title: LDAPCP doesn’t work for multiple claims provider
body:
Hello @Yvand,

At present, we have a web application in SharePoint configured with an Identity Provider, with LDAPCP as a claim provider. Everything works as per the requirements in this case.

Now we have another web application in same SharePoint farm configured with a different Identity Provider. At this point, when tested the sites were accessible for this new second webapp. Now in this case when we try to map the same LDAPCP for the second webapp, the Claims mapping and the Global configuration page in Central Admin site loses it initial settings and the mapping values.

We had to remove the Identity Provider from the second webapp. After doing this, the Claims mapping and the Global configuration page in Central Admin site got its initial settings and mapping values restored back.

We would like to know how can we configure LDAPCP to work for multiple claims provider in the same SharePoint farm?

Awaiting your reply. Thanks.

title: Issue with the Claim Augementation
body:
Hi,

there is a subtle issue with the method "Augment" for the Claims Augmentation. If a WebApplication has multiple different authentication methods, e.g. Windows, Forms & ADFS, the method FillClaimsForEntity will be called with different kinds of identities, latest when a token is re-issued after 1 hour. This in turn alls Augment for the heavy lifting which in turn calls "RunWithElevatedPrivileges" as it's first action.
This call will result in a call to FillClaimsForEntity if the user is not a Windows user, e.g. a Forms user,  creating an infinite loop resulting in a Stack Overflow.

- Eduard
